intro: Petrophile aculeata, commonly known as the spiked rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its erect, spindly stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that are clustered in cylindrical inflorescences. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Petrophile aculeata is typically found in open habitats and is well-suited to drought conditions.
